meanings.definition: The quality or state of being variable.
meanings.sent1: The variablenesses of the weather make it hard to predict.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the variablenesses in the experiment results.
meanings.sent3: The variablenesses in her mood kept everyone guessing.
meanings.sent4: The variablenesses of the stock market can be challenging to navigate.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the variablenesses of the math problem with examples.

meanings.definition: The condition of being subject to change or variation.
meanings.sent1: The variablenesses in the economy affect businesses.
meanings.sent2: She embraced the variablenesses of life with optimism.
meanings.sent3: The variablenesses in the movie plot kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent4: His variablenesses in decision-making surprised his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the variablenesses of technology is crucial in today's world.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being inconsistent or fluctuating.
meanings.sent1: The variablenesses in her performance puzzled the judges.
meanings.sent2: The variablenesses of his excuses made his story unbelievable.
meanings.sent3: The variablenesses in the recipe resulted in a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: His variablenesses in behavior made him unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The variablenesses of the music added excitement to the concert.
